description: (3 x Apple (applicant's ref. T1, T4) - Clean, thin and reduce crown as necessary to promote fruit production and quality);1 x Apricot (applicant's ref. T2) - Selective prune balance form (deadwood);1 x Malus Crabapple (applicant's ref. T3) - Selective prune balance crown remove suckers at base;1 x Hawthorn (applicant's ref. T5) - Reduce crown height and spread by approximately 2-3 metres, Thin crown approximately 10% as specified;1 x Plum (applicant's ref. T6) -  Reduce crown height by approximately 2-3 metres, Reduce crown spread right side by approximately 2-3 metres, Reduce crown spread left side by approximately 2-2.5 metres, Thin crown approximately 10% as specified;Yew group (applicant's ref. T7) - Reduce crown spread by approximately 1-2 metres to provide clearance to adjacent tree;1 x Acer (applicant's ref. T8) - Reduce crown height and spread by approximately 0.5-0.6 metres, Clean to remove all (dead,) diseased and broken branches 1 centimetres in diameter and larger throughout crown;1 x Acer (applicant's ref. T9) - Renovate and balance by selective punning [pruning] to maintain a tree shape;1 x Cherry (applicant's ref. T10) - Reduce crown height and spread by approximately 1-2 metres, Clean to remove all (dead,) diseased and broken branches 1 centimetres in diameter and larger throughout crown;1 x Magnolia (applicant's ref. T11) -  Reduce crown height by approximately 1-2 metres, Reduce crown spread by approximately 0.5-1 metre
